sn12.48:1.2: Then a brahmin cosmologist went up to the Buddha …
sn12.48:1.3: Seated to one side he said to the Buddha:
sn12.48:2.2: “‘All exists’: this is the oldest cosmology, brahmin.”
sn12.48:3.2: “‘All doesn’t exist’: this is the second cosmology.
sn12.48:4.2: “‘All is a unity’: this is the third cosmology.
sn12.48:5.2: “‘All is a plurality’: this is the fourth cosmology.
sn12.48:6.1: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One teaches by the middle way:
sn12.48:6.3: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.48:6.4: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.48:6.5: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.48:6.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.’”
sn12.48:7.1: When he said this, the brahmin cosmologist said to the Buddha,
sn12.48:7.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
